title: AB 1622
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Item 2240-101-6082 of Section 2.00 of the Budget Act of 2016 is amended to allocate $75,000,000 for local assistance to the Department of Housing and Community Development from the Housing for Veterans Fund. The Director of Finance can authorize an increase in this appropriation based on the proceeds available from the Veterans Housing and Homeless Prevention Bond Act of 2014, with notification to the appropriate legislative committees. Funds in this item can be used to pay off commitments until June 30, 2022, with a possible extension granted by the Director of Finance. Approval for an extension must be given in writing to specific legislative committees. $10,000,000 from this item will be available for loans for transitional housing or shelter facilities for homeless veterans, prioritizing long-term solutions like mental health and addiction treatment services. Item 2240-105-0001 is amended to allocate $45,000,000 to the Emergency Housing and Assistance Fund. The funds transferred by this item, totaling $45,000,000, will be used for support costs and local assistance for the California Emergency Solutions Grant Program. Additionally, $10,000,000 will be allocated to the Office of Emergency Services for Homeless Youth Emergency Service Pilot Projects in specific counties. Item 4260-001-3085 of the Budget Act of 2016 is amended to allocate $13,620,000 for the Department of Health Care Services from the Mental Health Services Fund. The curr_chunk states that $13,620,000 is allocated for the Department of Health Care Services. The funds are in lieu of amounts that would have been appropriated for administration under a specific section of the Welfare and Institutions Code. $4,000,000 is allocated for suicide hotlines in the state until June 30, 2019, subject to availability of funds from the Mental Health Services Fund. Notification of fund availability must be provided by the Department of Finance before release. The Budget Act of 2016 is amended to include various bills related to appropriations. These bills are considered Budget Bills under the California Constitution. The act is effective immediately.
